head.title: Sense of Urgency for Clinton on Arms Issue

hedline.hl1: Sense of Urgency for Clinton on Arms Issue

block.p: Administration officials had insisted that the meeting between the American and Russian presidents should not be viewed as focusing on arms control. But it was. The main purpose was to soften the Kremlin's resistance to American plans for a limited missile defense and to pave the way for a new arms control framework by the end of the Clinton presidency.
Two days of meetings, however, failed to produce progress on either count, and the prospects for a breakthrough on Mr. Clinton's watch seem as dim as ever.

The main purpose was to soften the Kremlin's resistance to American plans for a limited missile defense and to pave the way for a new arms control framework by the end of the Clinton presidency.

The Clinton administration approached the meeting with a sense of urgency because it is eager to add to its legacy and because of its schedule for deploying an antimissile system. It came away with modest shifts in the Russian positions and an agreement on guidelines for future talks.
